newsitem.title: ITALY: Verdict postponed in Fiat chief's trial.
newsitem.headline: Verdict postponed in Fiat chief's trial.

text.p: A court session to give the verdict in the fraud trial of Cesare Romiti, chairman of Italian carmaker Fiat , has been postponed until April 9, lawyers at the court said.
Lawyers said they had been told by presiding judge Francesco Saluzzo he could not attend due to other commitments.
Romiti is on trial with Fiat finance director Francesco Paolo Mattioli and both men are charged with accounting fraud and making illegal payments to politicians and managers working overseas.
Romiti is also believed to be charged with tax fraud in the trial which is being conducted behind closed doors under a fast-track, plea-bargaining procedure.
